value.0: Hello again. What can the Courier Company do for you today?

Over to the Commonwealth Centre, due west of here, across the square. You can't miss it really, the Pillars of Law are right outside of it. They have all the information you could need about petitioning for citizenship there.
How is it going with those deliveries?
Excellent! You've been a huge help <lad/lass>. <StartAction>[*slides a small coin purse across the counter*]</Start> Here's something for your troubles.
How is it going with those deliveries?
You really are new to Cordor, aren't you. Alright then, not to worry, I'll steer you in the right direction. Now lets see...

You should head to the southern district first I'd say, so just keep walking southwest from the Company here and inbetween the Market Hall and the Blue Skies Academy you'll find the street to South Cordor. Once you're in the south, walk south and west and you'll find Captain Guston's ship docked on the far end there. He knows the seas around these parts very well and can take you almost anywhere in the region.

One of the two sewer entrances is just north of the gypsy's stand in the northeast corner of South Cordor. The other is in East Cordor, and there should be a foreman down below either entrance.

Head back up here to East Cordor and duck into the Market Hall you passed earlier and you'll find Hil'rash and Tristana inside; Hil'rash does all sorts of importing and exporting so he's the best one to sell unusual items to, while Tristana offers healing supplies. Most of the trading is done here, though there are some specialty shops elsewhere in the district as well. Armuth the Fletcher has a shop right across from this office, and Haur's smithy is just around the corner from the fletchers'. Any weapons or armor you might need, they're the ones to see. Lastly, in the northern section of East Cordor is where the map maker keeps his shop. Just head over the bridge near the Horde monument; you'll see the Library and road to Central and West Cordor on your left, and if you turn right you'll find a strange mosaic right outside the Map Maker's office. You should take the opportunity to get a look at the geography of the island while you're there.

And then just come right back here and you'll be done! Hope that makes it a bit more clear for you.
Welcome to the Commonwealth Courier Company. I'm Pickering, the proprieter. How can I help you?

Oh it's pretty simple really, we deliver various packages to the fine citizens of the Commonwealth. Anyone who shows us their citizenship papers can leave a parcel or package with us, and we make sure it reaches its destination in a timely fashion. Though we're a bit run off our feet today to be honest.

Over to the Commonwealth Centre, due west of here, across the square. You can't miss it really, the Pillars of Law are right outside of it. They have all the information you could need about petitioning for citizenship there.

I shouldn't be letting you even touch a package, since you're not part of the company, but we're really behind today... so I suppose I could get you to deliver a few basic things, nothing of value. Do the job right and I can give you a day's pay for helping out.

<StartAction>[*Pickering hesitates, thinking over the offer, but eventually relents*]</Start> Well... I suppose I could give you some of the less sensitive deliveries to make. Not really anything of value, since you're not part of the company you understand.

<StartAction>[*he ducks behind the counter, rummaging around... and comes back up with several packages and parcels of various sizes*]</Start>

Lets see... I have parcels for Haur the blacksmith as well as the Fletcher, Hil'rash at the Merchant Hall as well as a package for Tristana there as well and some dyes for the map maker all here in East Cordor. Captain Guston has a letter here; he docks his boat in South Cordor usually. And then I have some supplies for the sewer cleaners, those can go to either foreman at the South or East entrances to the sewers.

<StartAction>[*setting each of the small boxes and sealed letters into an old, beat up satchel like the one you saw on the courier that nearly ran you over, he passes the satchel to you*]</Start>

Well most of them will give you a little something for your trouble, and when you return to me and show me what you got from them, I'll know you did the job right and will pay you for your work. That's worth it, isn't it? And if you want to save yourself some walking, you can always pay for a gondola ride between the different districts, there's one in each.
<StartAction>[*huffs*]</Start> Fine. Quit wasting my time till you're ready then. <StartAction>[*takes the satchel back and stuffs it under the counter*]</Start>
If you need any more detailed directions, just come talk to me again!
Nothing particular thanks, just passing through.
You had mentioned something about citizenship before?
Perhaps I'll go look into it now.
All the parcels you gave me are delivered, and here's the proof of delivery from each person. <StartAction>[*passes the satchel back to Pickering*]</Start>
I'll spend it well. Good day Pickering.
I'm actually having trouble finding my way around the city. Could you give me a few more details on how to find the people you wanted me to deliver these parcels to?
[CONTINUE]
It certainly does, thank you!
What services do you offer here exactly?
I've little interest in such work.
Citizenship? Where could I find out more about that?
Perhaps I'll go look into it now.
Well, if there's pay involved, I could run a few of your deliveries.
Perhaps I could help with some of those packages?
I understand. What do I need to deliver?
That's... quite a lot to deliver.
Well on second thought, I'm not so sure I have time right now. I'll come back later if I want the work.
You're right. I'll be back once these are all delivered. <StartAction>[*takes the satchel and leaves*]</Start>
